page.title: 10SOUTH MARSTON AIRFIELD (1)
page.content:
In 1942 the airfield belonged to Short Brothers, then it was sold to{Vickers. During World War Two the factory employed 4,000 people in the consruction of aircraft, the airfield employed over 400 people, who maintained and dispatched aircraft to the RAF. The last Spitfire fighter left the factory in 1954.
Today the airfield houses one{Cessna {Citation executive jet}which seats six passengers.{Vickers}employ two ground crew, two traffic controllers, two senior pilots and two second pilots to operate the aircraft.
The jet flies to destinations in both the UK and Europe. It is used constantly by{Vickers,}and different aircraft are also permitted to land between 9 am and 5 pm on weekdays.
